title: Is there any possible way to earn money without investment? - Quora

response.answer_text: Put a small group of investors together. Your equal share contribution is running the group. I've been telling everyone that for about a year on Quora.Three days ago, on Friday, I decided I was going to do the same thing: start an investment group just so I could tell about my experiences and successes with an investment group. I haven't even had time to start the LLC, when I got a phone call from a friend that I had helped in the past. They were calling me looking for a place to invest. I just told them I was starting an investment group and going to be investing in more real estate. My first investor put in $700K as an initial investment. The investors get their money back on every deal, then the profits are split. Rather than make this just a two party deal and keep half of the profit for myself, I decided that I wanted to help someone else get wealthy too. I invited him to participate as an equal partner witha three way split. His contribution is finding deals to invest in with me. He doesn't put any money into the deals either and will receive 1/3 of the profits from the LLC. The investor will make a huge return over what a bank would have offered them, and each deal is 100% backed by real estate at below market values.That's one way that you can make money without an investment. You will have to put in time and talent as your contribution. Make sure you are completely honest and upfront about everything if you try this. If you're not an honest person, you will very likely go to prison if you attempt this. I have a friend that will be in prison for seventeen years, because he tried this and got greedy. He stole from his friends/investors. He destroyed several families, made it so that a number of people would literally never be able to retire, and financially devastated dozens of people. My goal is for everyone to make a very nice additional income without using much of the investor's money. I think we can safely add at least $250K a year to each of our incomes and have some great fun doing it. Before long, we should have a number of additional paid off income producing properties and have an LLC worth low eight-figures. I'm not a rocket scientist. If I can do this, you can too! I'm doing it to show you that it can be done and what the results can become. I don't care what your daddy told you… It doesn't take money to make money!

The key is a high Return on Investment (ROI). For example, imagine that there are two investments, Investment A and Investment B. Investment A has an ROI of 2%.Investment B has an ROI of 5%.I mean, big deal, right? Just 3%, not a big difference… Let’s do a simulation, though. If we invest $100 into Investment A and $100 into Investment B and wait ten years, what will happen? After one year: Investment A: $102 Investment B: $105 Big deal, right? Just put it in the 2% investment (e.g. a money market account at a bank). It’s not worth it to go to the trouble to invest in something high-yield for just $3! Oh, wait… After three years: Investment A: $106.12 Investment B: $115.76 Okay, now we’re starting to see a bigger difference… What about 10 years? Investment A: $121.89 Investment B: $162.88 Whoa! Big difference! Investment B outperformed Investment A by $40.99! What about 30 years? Someone thinking about retirement, at the beginning or towards the middle of his career, might think about a time horizon like this. Investment A: $181.13 Investment B: $432.19 The difference is between twofold and threefold! The key is a high ROI. Which things give high ROI? Stocks: They have very high ROI, but also have very high volatility. That means that on average, their ROI is some of the best, but in any given year (or even several years), they can go *WAY DOWN*!Real estate: This is much safer. The ROI is also quite high, probably not as high as with stocks, but unlike stocks, a sudden drop in value one year (or two years, three years, etc.) is very rare.Japanese real estate has a high average ROI if you buy it in major urban areas (Tokyo, Osaka, Fukuoka, etc.). Average ROI in the 23 Special Wards of Tokyo is 5.5%. In the outlying areas, it’s 6.5%. In specialty properties such as Niseko ski resort, it’s 7%. With Japanese real estate (which not only Japanese people, but also foreigners, including overseas investors, can buy), you can make ROI like the one above in Investment B, maybe even better.  ↑An Urban Area in Japan Imagine that there are two people, Person A and Person B. Person A has $100,000 to start. He puts his money in a money market account in the US with 2% interest. Person B has only $50,0000 to start ( :- ( ). He invests in Japanese real estate, making a 5% net ROI (ROI after property manager fees, taxes, maintenance and repairs, etc.). After 30 years, how will they have done? Person A will have $181,136.15. Not bad! Person B will have $216,097.11. WOW!!! And that’s how you can earn money with less investment and more profit. Person B did it. So can you! There you go. How to Buy Japanese Real Estate from Overseas

You don’t need money to make money. What you need is something that can create capital. Example: hunters in the midwestern, and eastern United States, love to go hunting for pheasant (a type of wild bird, and considered a delicacy by some.) they load up their dogs and get their permits then head out to the open fields and hunt. So one enterprising you man that I knew. Lived on a rural farm in Kansas would set up a place in his barn where he raised pheasants and he would let, (with the permission of his father) hunters come to the farm and hunt for pheasants. They always got lots of pheasants. That is because he would turn loose some birds in the fields the same day the hunters came for the weekend to hunt. His land always has pheasants, and developed a good reputation. He began to provide lodging and a great steak meal for the hunters. Hunters would book a year in advance to stay at his place and he collected a little non refundable deposit. So a teenager on a remote farm in the middle of nowhere Kansas where there were no jobs anyway, started a home business that paid totally for his college education before he ever even graduated from high school. He went on to be an auctioneer and made a small fortune. So take inventory of everything that is around, because anything could be a potential resource for a business. Use your imagination and become a capital creator not a worker. Pheasants are capital. By creating a positive environment for pheasants to thrive he could stand back and let them do their thing, (grow and make more pheasants.) Now his job was to just convert the capital into cash. He could sell the eggs the birds laid. He could let hunters hunt them for a fee. He could sell the feathers. He could sell the live birds to other growers, or restaurants. Capital can be anything. The principal is to start a business, not find a job. Create an environment where capital can be produced, with little to no work on your part. Like in the case of the birds. While he was in school or sleeping those birds were growing and making more birds. (they want to live, and really don’t need anyone’s help to do it, but that doesn’t mean that you couldn’t make it easy for them. So the more you help them by creating a great environment the better for everyone.) You could raise earth worms. You could do yard work in your neighborhood. Raking up tree leaves and hauling them away. You get paid to do the work and then charge a little fee to haul away the debris, by adding that this will be eco friendly and won’t fill up the home owners trash cans when your done. Turn it into a by-weekly service till fall is over. The leaves you take home and pile into worm beds, or plastic bags. The worms get great foods a safe environment from birds and they double in population every 30 to 45 days. The worms make excellent soil to grow plants and they make an incredible natural plant fertilizer. The next spring you grow tomatoes in the soil that you made from the leaves you got to rake. The waste product from one business becomes an input for a new business. You can sell earth worms. Earth worm tea, and now organic tomatoes to all your neighbors. Doesn’t matter how old you are. Putting money in your pocket is putting money in your pocket. No having to wear a polyester shirt and pants and work at Macdonald’s to get a few dollars. You have the potential to will make more money working for yourself than you ever will working for someone else. The world is full of opportunities. The whole point of an education is to learn to recognize them when you see one. Cheers young one, I wish you success.

Would not it be great if you can make money without working?The surefire way to make a fortune in this way remains to be invented. However,by applying certain techniques, you can improve your income by providing virtually no effort. It is also possible to make investments or work to get rich. However, be aware that you'll have better luck if you choose a job outside the box. Earn Money without Working 1) Inherit. If you have an old and rich relative, you are likely to inherit. Just wait for the opening day of his will. Of course, if your parent loves you, he will be inclined to leave you something. So, try to stay on good terms with your elderly parents. Of course, it is extremely suspicious and painful to treat older people with respect and love only to get their money later. 2) Win the Lottery.Generally, a lottery ticket costs only a few euros. These tickets are available in most grocery stores and convenience stores. This is an economical and easy way to earn money. However, your chances of winning the jackpot will be trivial compared to losing your bet. Always expect to lose money buying a lottery ticket. It is true that to win the lottery, you must first buy at least one ticket. However,be realistic because you cannot rely on this method to meet your needs. In other words, you have one chance in 13,983,816 of winning the "Lottery"if you are in the United States, the ratio is 1/200 000 000 to win the"Power ball Jackpot."  Enter a Competition.As the lottery, contest or a contest can totally change your life in the space of an evening. You do not have many chances to win, but it can happen. Indeed,if you participate often, you will have more favorable opportunities to earn money and other prices.  Compared to the lottery, contest offers participants the advantage of being free. Make an online search, including social media to discover lotteries and competitions in which you can participate for free. You can also find assistance by paying attention to advertising in stores.Moreover, for most of the contest, you will not need to purchase to register. If you take it seriously, try to subscribe to a specialized periodical publication. Thus, you save time by being regularly informed about the contests scheduled at the local or national level.However, beware of false competition and be careful to avoid scams. To receive earnings obtained in an honest contest, you will never be obliged to pay a fee or provide a credit card number. Listen carefully to the personal information you provide in registering for these competitions.

How Can I Earn Money Without Investing Money?  It’s possible, but difficult. Anyone who is selling you anything else is simply trying to take your money without earning it. I’ve outlined five principles that you’ll need to know to succeed. If you walk away with a deep understanding of the first one, you’ll already be years ahead of the “how to make money online” scammers you’ll find everywhere else. 1. You can only earn money from your TIME or your ASSETS If you work a job, you are earning money from the time you contribute, the time it took for you to learn the job skills, and the assets (knowledge) inside of your head. If you rent out a house, you are earning money from your assets. If you freelance, you are earning money from your time. If you drive for Uber or Lyft, you are using your time and assets. See the trend? You need to provide value to someone else with your time or assets if you want to earn money. Read that again. Let it sink in. Then read it again. That’s how you earn money. 2. If you can’t invest money, you will need to invest time Every month, I pay freelancers to do web scraping and data entry. They offer their time. They don’t invest any money, and they get paid. I’m doing this because it saves me time. Time that I can leverage to earn more than I’m paying them because of my knowledge and skills. You need to choose if you’d like to trade your time for money, or if you have any assets that you can rent out for money. 3. Figure out what your talents and skills Are you a great writer? You can earn a six-figure salary freelance writing. You can do it as a side-hustle. You can do it full-time. You can do it from anywhere in the world. You can start freelance writing without any monetary investment, and it’s one of the best freelance careers available. Are you a great designer? Perhaps you can freelance graphic design. Even better, you can use software like Webflow, Wordpress, or Wix to build websites. Companies need logos and brand kits. But they pay immensely for web design and development. Do you have a spare bedroom? An underused car? Can you rent out either? Can you drive for Uber or Lyft? Have you offered tutoring or coaching services for sports, academics, or music? Do you have unique experiences that others would pay to learn from as a consultant? Make a list of your talents and skills, and put a star next to the ones that other people would pay to have. 4. Sell your extra things Most of us have unused clothes, old electronics, or random luxuries we rarely use. Sell them. The monetary investment has already been made – just make the listings on eBay or Craigslist and sell them. This is probably the fastest, most reliable, and easiest way to make money from your assets. 5. Iterate and Improve You’ve sold your items that you don’t care for. You’ve placed ads and rented out any assets possible for cash flow. You’re starting to look into services you can offer that people are willing to pay for. What’s next? Iterate and improve. Maybe you haven’t found the service you’d like to offer. Maybe you have, but you haven’t been able to successfully market your services. Maybe you can bake the best muffins in the world, but you simply need to reach out to more local coffee shops. Figure out what you need to do to succeed. Find people who have succeed before you and follow their footsteps. Reach out to them for help. P.S. Upvote if you liked this answer and you’d like to see more like it! If this receives enough Upvotes, I’ll continue to update it with more information and new ideas over time!

NO MONEY DOES NOT STOP YOU… Most of the time when I ask people what their challenges are, they come back and tell me it is a lack of money, a lack of finance, a lack of the green stuff that makes the world go round… And I listen to them and depending on what stage we are in our relationship because some people just do not want to hear the truth, I tell them that money has absolutely nothing to do with whether they succeed in business or not. After all, which successful entrepreneur started any business with a lot of their own money?! HARDLY ANYONE! In fact, one of the big reasons they started out in business was to create wealth for themselves and their family… Yes, I know you are not in it just for the money, but you do want money, right? So, own that now and stop beating around the bush about it… So, you are now telling me that money is the result you want and money is also the path to the result? Well, you are kinda screwed then… Because if according to you, it is money that is preventing you from getting money, then you are stuck. And you will remain stuck until you realise that money has nothing to do with whether you make your business a success or not… The truth is, you could go apply for a credit card (unless you are in some third world country somewhere or maybe your credit is bad but I have to say, I went bankrupt and still I was able to get access to this type of money) and get some money that way… Yes, I know that makes you uncomfortable and why? Because deep inside, you are scared of racking up debt when you do not know if your business idea is going to work… And that is definitely a sensible way of thinking about it but it is also the crux of your problem… If you do not believe your business idea is going to work, you will not give it all the energy of THOUGHT and ACTION that you need to give it, in order for it to work. So, your problem as you can hopefully begin to see is more than a lack of finance, it is a lack of belief in yourself and your ability to succeed and so because you, deep down, don’t believe in you or your ideas, you will not use the vast and powerful resourcefulness, that GOD himself has gifted you with, to create wealth in your business. And instead of you admitting the truth of that to yourself… You will blame a lack of money as the reason that you fail or never even began… PLEASE, honey, tell someone else that particular story because I am not buying it! If you want something, you always find a way to get it. You do, honey, you really do! You are a lot more powerful than you give yourself credit for… And you are just blocking your own brain up and setting yourself up for failure when you tell me or anyone and worst of all, yourself, that it is a lack of money that stops you. It gives you permission not to think of another way forward… It gives you permission to remain stuck in place… It gives you permission not to try… And so, honey, you get what you want… You fail! And then you can go back to your old, comfortable life and tell yourself that you tried. WHAT UTTER NONSENSE! Lots of people have built business without any of their own money, they just had a huge amount of belief and if they really did need money (A lot of businesses really do not need any huge amounts of capital)… IF they did need money, then their huge amounts of belief would enable them to find a sponsor who sees the validity and potential of their ideas and who then bankrolls them. But it all starts with you believing in yourself and your idea enough to make it work. Money is NO obstacle. If anything, too much money at the start, stifles creativity. And it is your creativity that will make your business succeed. Go on… Write out TEN ways you can use today to get your message out without spending any money whatsoever. And then go do it. Yes, I know it will be hard for you to think like this because you have forgotten how to think hard for what you want… And yet, understand that the more you do this kind of thinking, the easier it becomes, the more creative you become, the more innovative your ideas become and the quicker you succeed in making money. As long as you then go implement the ideas… And this works wherever you live, third world country or not. You need to get into the habit of thinking there is always a way and you also need to realise the only challenge you actually have, is YOU! And getting over your reasons and excuses for not doing what it takes to win. THE SHORT ANSWER: GET CREATIVE!

That’s the $ 1,000,000 question, no? I DON’T KNOW and I DO KNOW. I’ve been a banker for some 10 yrs (I still am, but not the kind of banker people often get to see - a phantom banker: I work on a special department for large loans, meaning that I can go to work in jeans, wearing sneakers, black metal t-shirts as I only see 1 or 2 customers per week ; for those cases I have a suit that’s hidden in the infirmary room. What I think is that we’re heading for a serious number of people who’ll soon be the victims of all the new methods you see occurring online. It’s not a regulated market yet and there’s a lot of cowboys out there, who are not interested in your finances, but in their own. Always when new ways of paying appear, as they do now, clever thieves will find a way to detect the holes, the backdoors, tricks and the traps to funnel your gains to their accounts in St. Kitts And Nevis. I saw you got some 7 answers: read them and ask yourself what the only motivation of people OFFERING you ways of getting rich can be. Identically the same as the banks’ motives. I know banks inside out and the last worry on their minds is offering you the best investment plans. Moreover, I’m sure you need a couple of skills I suppose you don’t have (I definitely haven’t got them). You should know about hacking, avoid several security levels, know the nitty-gritty about hardware; you should have a system in place that automatically in nanoseconds sends the money that comes in five times around Planet Earth. I used to know how to do that (as before the loans, I was the kind of guy to go to when you had too much black money and you wanted to launder it. However, the software, our special intranet (I work in one of the most profitable and prestigious banks of the world - they sponsor Formula One races) the opportunities, the regulations have changed completely the last few years. I hated that job, as my clients, being VERY wealthy people, getting wealthier all the time, NEVER were satisfied and complained about it in front of ME, who got a mediocre paycheck, never had had serious amounts on my account and at the end of the year got a bonus of - fasten seatbelts - € 200,00 = TWO HUNDRED. And even if I had worked out a very profitable investment plan (with a net gain of 70%/year, untaxed), NEVER I got a tip, NEVER a ‘thank you’ or a pat on the back. On the contrary, they took their profit and brought it to a small specialized investment bank, of which their friends had told them they had a 77% gain. And who was to blame for that? Me! It got so far that I got inside information on a textile manufacturer (a real money machine) who would go to the stock market. The reason was to give the founding brothers the chance to ‘cash in’ on their OWN stocks (85% of the available stocks). What happens in such cases: the day the stocks are for sale: people see that the price rises like a rocket in the morning. They buy, even if the price is already waaaaaaay too high, they stubbornly believe trees will keep growing into heaven. Then, the 3 bros sell, fill their pockets and the price crashes. All this in 50 minutes. The other buyers have paid € 40 for stocks that suddenly have a value of € 2,50 and never recover. Of course not: the difference of 40 and 2,50 (37,50) is and will stay in the pockets of the brothers. If I steal a jeans that costs € 37,50, I’m in serious trouble. Those guys get interviewed on TV and introduced as smart businessmen. I’ll tell you something: if you don’t know enough of the hidden dangers of e.g. e-commerce or plastic money systems, don’t do it. You’ll burn your ass. It’s a good thing to know your weaknesses and your strengths. Don’t waste your time on getting rid of your weaknesses, invest it in your strengths. I know it’s frustrating to see rich guys getting richer, becoming Partners etc. But, why don’t you keep it simple. A Harvard Master’s degree or pH D is great, but your life will be stressfull, you’ll have to fight with colleagues, stealing their ideas, taking care they don’t steal yours. At 50 they can fire you; no: every day they can give you the sack. Harvard or not. It takes 6 months to become a skilled plumber. Work hard the first few years, save what you can and as soon as you can start a business on your own. You’ll need tools (the big ones can be rented, the smaller ones don’t cost a fortune) , you’ll need a humble ‘office’, a phone, pc, printer and a van (second-hand). BE SMART and paint the van yellow or fluo-green. Put your ads between the small ads in local papers, also in green or yellow. Print on the van: “CALL WAYNE 123-xxxxyyyy AND AWAY GO TROUBLES DOWN THE DRAIN”. Make sure you don’t have to do the work yourself too long, hire others to do it. Your job is marketing, making offers, finances. The nice thing about plumbing is that you don’t just sell your working hours, but also bathrooms, furniture, heating devices, boilers, toilets, accessories (on which you make a hell of a profit). I have a cousin who worked with his dad until he was 38. He was poorly paid. When he was 42, he drove 2 BMWs X5, 2 large mercedes vans, he had bought land and a few horses for his daughter, he had his own shop AND he had the advantage to live in Belgium’s Beverly Hills, where people have appartments (yes, no mansions) costing up to € 1000,000,000, mansions with survival basements in case of nuclear attacks, where maybe 50% of the residents have a decent source of income (the others are drug lords, weapon traders with dangerous customers, pimps, people who never have had the necessity to work, gangsters who have served their time - in Belgium you can get out in 2 years for 10 years of producing methamphetamine or illegal hormones, given to livestock). I’m sure if you choose a job that ALWAYS will be necessary, you can get rich. You won’t be interviewed, but you’ll lead a good, comfortable life. My answer can be the opposite of what you had hoped (it’s not a prestigious job, no suit and tie required), but it’s worth thinking about. I have an PH.D in Economics. I was the first of my final year at university: ‘laureate’ even. But, I had no money. What could I do with my fancy grades? I’ll tell you: write 100 letters for jobs, mainly as salesman (I had opted for ‘Marketing’). If only I could turn back time… SUCCESS Curious what you think.

Absolutely. Money will almost never be earned without some form of investment, however.  You can invest your time and energy.This is what Benjamin Franklin meant when he said that time is money. In order to earn money via an investment of our time, we have to trade a finite piece of our lives in exchange for it. While some people prefer product-oriented companies and startups, you yourself can trade your labor in order to provide a service—applying for a retail job, mowing lawns for people who already have yard equipment, or using whatever device you’re reading this on to edit pictures, develop apps, or build websites. You can invest resources that you already have.My first $100 was earned from a Minecraft server I made in middle school. I used my parents’ horribly slow, lagging computer in their utility room to run it for free. This did require a “resource,” and likely added on to the utility bill, obviously, but I didn’t need anything more than most people who are reading this already have access to. If you’re absolutely hell-bent on starting out without investing a penny, you may need to harness your inner resourcefulness.

Talking in the world of finance, it’s not possible. TL;DR : No-Arbitrage Principle  Let’s say that dealer A in New York offers to buy British pounds at the rate of $1.60 per pound. And let’s say dealer B in London offers to sell them at the rate of $1.58 per pound. That’s a golden opportunity, isn’t it? You can cash out $0.02 on each transaction. This is called as an Arbitrage opportunity.  A lot of time arbitrage opportunities are not directly in sight. Now, let’s say that dealer A in New York offers to buy British pounds at the rate of $1.58 (previously it was $1.60); and dealer B in London would sell it as $1.60 (which was $1.58 in previous example). So, there is definitely no profit for you in this right? But, let’s say that dollars can be borrowed at the annual rate of 4% and British Pounds can be invested in bank at 7%. Voila! There’s an arbitrage opportunity! You can make some money out of this!  Here’s a thing about arbitrages though. Amount of transactions required are too large, (which makes it out of reach from smaller investors) and profits are low. Besides that, transaction and operating fees decreases the profit further. Also, when somebody sees that Mr.X is making a lot of money out of arbitrage, they’ll start playing the same game. And eventually, the opportunity disappears when dealers in New York and London resettles the prices.  No-Arbitrage Principle: There is no admissible portfolio with initial value of zero such that final value being more than one with a non-zero probability. In simple words, no investor can lock in profits without risk and with no initial endowment.

To make money, you essentially need to invest time and money. If you don’t have time, you need to spend money to buy services from others. If you don’t have money, you need to commit time and effort to learning new things, trying out new ideas, and ruthlessly implementing your chosen strategy and plan. Time and money are two trade-offs that you must balance and manage in order to earn money. I have complied a comprehensive list of money making ideas to get your creative juices flowing.  Without any money or investment to start off with when trying to earn money, there are a number of limitations that you must know. Lets take a making money online example to illustrate the point that you really need to make an investment to earn money. Given that you don’t own or control any platform or website, you must use existing FREE platforms and systems like WordPress.com: Create a free website or blog, eBay, Amazon, Fiverr, etc. The good thing about these established platforms is that you have lots of willing buyers already searching for products and services to buy within the platform itself. You don’t need to drive Internet traffic to the website. The downside is that information about and pricing of your products and services will be transparent for everyone to see and challenge. Price and product comparisons are made so easy with their comparison functions. This will attract copycats who will be your competitors, thus reducing your profit margins. Some may even sabotage your sales by buying up your entire inventory during a holiday sales season and returning them after. With the Internet, the entry barriers are so low that anyone without money can try to make money online. With that, comes increased competition. The marketplace has become so crowded and competitive that you need to create your own unique voice in order to make decent amounts of money, Another downside is that all these existing platforms use some kind of customer voting systems. You are subjected to the games people play with satisfaction ranking scores. You may even be adversely impacted if there are non-genuine negative feedbacks. Customers these days are so difficult to please that you must manage customer expectations. . Be aware that while these platforms are ‘free’, you are limited and controlled by their terms of use and operational fancies. You are also subjected to their indiscriminate policy changes. The bottom line is that you are at their mercy! I had my free account terminated by an established platform provider because I violated their “policy” as determined by their automated screening process! They generally use keywords to track your activities. If you unintentionally use one or more of these prohibited keywords on their platform, their system algorithms will immediately assume that you intentionally violated their terms of use. Your account will be immediately terminated or suspended. The beauty part is that you are presumed guilty without any likelihood of an appeal. . Here’s the key problem. If your entire business model and income source are totally reliant or dependent on this one FREE platform, then your income will immediately disappear or be wiped out overnight if you unintentionally violated their policies. That’s why it is advisable for you to spend a bit of money to get your own website or platform up and running as quickly as possible when you have made some profits so that you have total control over it without the need to look at over your shoulders. . From a paid advertising perspective, you may need to set aside some initial advertising dollars to promote and sell your products on platforms like Facebook. Depending on what you do online, you may require some paid advertisements to get you started. Once you have generated sufficient online income from your products or services, you can reinvest some of your initial profits back into your business.  While you can start making money online without spending any money, once you have generated some income for yourself, you must immediately spend money to build your own platform so that you can have total control over your business and income streams. . Here are a couple of potential strategies you can adopt when starting out making money online without any money. If you like selling things online, then you could find some hot-selling products to sell from direct wholesale sites like AliExpress, advertise these products on eBay or Amazon at a higher price, collect money from your customer when a product is purchased, place your order on AliExpress for the product to be shipped directly to your customer without any physical handling by you, pay AliExpress for the product you bought on behalf of your customer, and keep the profit for yourself. This is an arbitraged or drop-ship strategy. You could also sell other people’s products or services as an affiliate. You can email your unique affiliate ID to your friends or advertise this unique affiliate ID on your own webpage created on free blogging sites like WordPress.com: Create a free website or blog, on your Facebook timeline, or on your Pinterest board. You could also do guest postings or write on Quora to promote thus unique ID. This is the affiliate marketing strategy. If you have your own services that people are willing and able to pay for, then you could use established platforms like Fiverr or UpWork to sell your services. You may have skills and experience that sells. To be successful in the long run for making money online, you need to establish a list of your own customers to up-sell products and services to them at a later date. Having free platforms may not allow you to capture your own customer’s email addresses for further upsells. As you do not have control over these free popular online platforms to make money from, you are totally subjected to the unpredictable application of their constantly changing terms of use. This could totally wipe out your only source of income instantly. . There are so many no-money or no-investment strategies that you can employ to earn money. In reality, you really need to make some commitment by investing money into your business, whether you like it or not.

Thanks to the wonders of the internet, it’s completely possible to bring in a steady side income from the comfort of your own home. If you want to know how to make money online, consider these possibilities: Open an Etsy store. If you have a creative talent or skill – whether it’s creating art, sewing clothes, or making keepsakes – you can open an online store on Etsy and sell your wares for some quick cash. With your own Etsy store, you’re left in charge of pricing and, ultimately, how much you make. Complete surveys online. Sites like Swagbucks and MyPoints pay people to share their opinions on products or services, test mobile apps, or participate in market research. While the payday for these sites is modest, participating frequently can help you earn extra money in a short amount of time. Get paid to search the Web. Zoombucks will pay you to use their online interface to search the web. To qualify, you need to be willing to download their search bar and use it for everyday Internet use. The only caveat that comes with this “gig” is that you might be paid in gift cards instead of cash. If you can parlay those gift cards into items you need to buy anyway – like groceries or gas – searching online can be a lucrative way to spend your free time. Evaluate search engines. Search engine evaluators use commonly-accessed search engines in order to seek out bugs or errors. You may not earn a lot, but you can do this job in your spare time and from the comfort of your own home. To find gigs, check sites like Leapforce, Lionbridge, and Appen Butler Hill. Start a blog. If you love writing and are passionate about a specific topic, starting a blog is a great way to launch a low-cost side business with little money out-of-pocket. All you need to get started is a domain name, some basic online support, and a head full of ideas to share. Write and publish an eBook. You don’t need a traditional publisher and financial backing to publish your own book anymore. In fact, Amazon makes it possible for you to publish your own eBook and sell it independently – with no financial investment on your part. And with Kindle eBook publishing, your book will appear on Kindle stores worldwide within 24-48 hours. Just be prepared to market it yourself on social media, your blog, or elsewhere if you expect to generate sales. Become a freelance writer or editor. If you have a passion for storytelling or a background in writing or editing, it’s possible to find freelance writing or editing work online. To search available job openings, check out sites like UpWork and Problogger. You can also check traditional job sites such as Indeed and enter “telecommute” or “anywhere” in the location field. Everybody has to start somewhere. Most of the wealthy people of today, started with close to $0 at 18, 21, 25 and sometimes even 30. Inherited wealth is a minority of the total wealth in most countries;  The tried and tested ways to get money are: to improve your skills and therefore your income. This could be hard skills (say a skill like engineering) or soft skills (communication, sales, marketing, negation).They could also be money management skills (investing, budgeting and so on)Wealth is net income - expenditure x compounded returns. However, all these three aspects are linked to skills. Budgeting skills helps you reduce your spending, without losing out on a good life. Negotiation helps with spending too, but also income if you are negotiating a pay rise. Business skills, from accounting all the way through to sales, helps you with income. Investing skills helps you compound. However, skills and mentality are linked. Many people know how to budget, spend sensibly, learn mew skills to make more money and the basics of investing. However, knowing something and implementation are two different things. Most of us know how to get a 6 pack., but few people achieve it. So mentality is also key. If you can merge skills with persistence, focus and long-term planning (delayed gratification as well), you have a winning combination. So I would take it step-by-step. Read a few books on business, investing and other useful topics. Learn some new skills. Learn how to work smarter with the 80/20 rule. If you can find a way to earn just 10%-20% more, and spend 10% less, that is a big deal if you can invest the surplus properly. You don’t always need to reinvent the wheel. It just takes time and patience to get there if you start with $0. You can get paid to do something. If you don’t have enough money to start buying assets and income streams, you’re going to have to work. Not necessarily as an employee in a job, though that is an option. But you’re going to have to use your time and energy to provide value to someone willing to pay for it.  If you’re smart, you’ll find the way to do this non-linearly. You have a finite amount of time to trade for money, and people will only pay you so much for it. Do work once that you can be paid for over and over again. Create something. Then be smart with your money so you have capital to invest. That’s what I’m working on. I’m documenting the whole process here.

There’s three basic ways to make money: Labour/TimeBuying and selling at a profitCapital investment (often owning something)As you have no money, 2 and 3 are out. So you have 1. You swap your time for cash. What your time is worth depends on the local demands and your skills. If you happen to be a good doctor, your time is worth more than a bad gardener - unless there is a real shortage of gardeners and a surplus of doctors. Note this does not have to mean you have to be employed - but just willing to do a service for money. Employment is one way to do it, but you can also be freelance, or set up your own company for pretty much nothing. So find something that needs doing that people are willing to pay for. This can often be broken down into two areas: Things they can’t do for themselves, that need specialist skills, such as programming, surgery, law, driving, etc.Things they can do, but don’t want to. These jobs can be either tedious or unpleasant (or both) but can also pay quite well in the right circumstances. I know one person who runs a business emptying toilet tanks - unpleasant work, but short hours and his staff are well paid for it.

You can make money, but don’t expect to get rich without investing or starting your own business. For just making money, find out what you are really good at. If it is something in demand without much competition then you are in luck. Get educated in that field either academically and/or by experience. As soon as you step into that field, you will know what to do. But if you don’t know what you are good at, then start the process of elimination. You will eliminate the work you hate or dislike, and will end up with a few career choices that you won’t mind. Then select the one that is in highest in demand and lowest in competition. You can find out by just doing a google search for “high paying careers”. There would be about 20 careers that would pay the most. Hopefully you will select one of them.

The answer to this question lies in understanding that money is a medium of exchange, not only for goods, but also for services - from manual labour to intellectual property. You print it. Seriously. But first, we have to define what “money” is. Money is traditionally defined as a currency that is divisible, portable, desirable, a unit of account and a store of value. Without doing any investment you will be restricting yourself from the magic of that eight wonder of the world i.e. compounding. You cannot earn money without doing any investment. Look, if you are in a job you are still investing the most precious thing i.e. your time and after a week or a month you are earning money. Here also you have invested something that is giving you something in return. After earning that money if you deposit that money in bank you can a specified rate of return. That also is investing . Now coming to what i earlier said about compounding. If you deposit your money in bank and do not withdraw it for years then you money will grow by itself(interest). Lets take an example. If you invest 100 rs and rate of interest is 10% then after one yeat you will have 110 rs. After second year you will get 10% on 110 and yoir amount will grow to 121. So after two years you will get 21 rs as interest. This is power of compounding by investing your money. I hope you got my point and will change your perspective on investing . Thank you for reading.

There are basically only three ways to make money - and they are all centered around business: Be an employee (work for a business)Start/own your own businessInvest in someone else’s business (true definition of investing)Just about every source of income falls into one of these three categories - and again, the common denominator is “business.” So you can even make the case that there’s only one way to make money. How much money you’ll make - or how passive that income is - will depend on your relationship to a certain business. It’s easiest to start as an employee - but that also has the lowest ceiling for your own earning potential. There are very few wealthy employees. If you want wealth, you must in some capacity own, partially own, or perhaps manage a business. Investing comes later - after you’ve already built up wealth and capital that you can then redeploy into separate opportunities that don’t require a lot of direct effort on your part. No matter where you currently are on the food chain, the #1 piece of advice I would give to someone looking to improve their financial situation is to go through life looking for opportunities to create value for other people. That’s the basis of all successful business - even if you’re “only” an employee, if you can demonstrate value creation for your employer, that’s how you rise within your profession and earn more responsibility and compensation in the future. Good luck!

The short answer is, it can’t be done. Whether you work a 9–5 job or invest money directly it’s always an investment. You invest your time and energy and in the latter you also invest your money along with those. If you work a 9 to 5 job, you’re giving your employer most of all, your time, but also your knowledge to accomplish something. In exchange for that you’re awarded with money. When you invest in stocks for example, you can consider it a full time job as well, with the only difference being that you have to give money and there’s no employer awarding you but it’s the market itself. What’s more, unknowingly, everything we do is based on investment, we invest in relationships, on products when we buy something and so on. It’s the way of life, you give something to get something in return.

Yes, just get a regular job. The investment is your time. Everyone on daily basis invests themselves in something to make a living. Even a beggar, he dresses up in a certain way to get attention of everyone around and waves or begs for money all day. That’s his investment to earn money.  A YouTuber comes up with an idea to make a video, things of a story line and starts recording it. Then edits it, add music to it if necessary and then uploads it. That’s his investment.  A car salesman, asks you about what you’re looking for. Then, shows you cars that meet your budget and price and style. You’re his investment for that moment.  You goto work, you clock in to start working and then clock out to leave work and start again next day. That’s your time investment to get hourly wages or salary.  A masseuse, gives massage and gets paid in return. They make anywhere from 50$-150$/hr but their job requires hand work which is equivalent to manual labor. So that’s their investment.  So anything you do in short, is your investment. Whatever you offer others is your goods and services! I would like you to ask yourself that would you be interested in someone that has nothing to give but wants your money?
